speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: SCENE I. Antioch. A room in the palace.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Enter ANTIOCHUS, Prince PERICLES, and followers

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Young prince of Tyre, you have at large received

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: The danger of the task you undertake.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I have, Antiochus, and, with a soul

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Embolden'd with the glory of her praise,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Think death no hazard in this enterprise.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Bring in our daughter, clothed like a bride,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: For the embracements even of Jove himself;

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: At whose conception, till Lucina reign'd,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Nature this dowry gave, to glad her presence,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: The senate-house of planets all did sit,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: To knit in her their best perfections.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Music. Enter the Daughter of ANTIOCHUS

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: See where she comes, apparell'd like the spring,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Graces her subjects, and her thoughts the king

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Of every virtue gives renown to men!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Her face the book of praises, where is read

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Nothing but curious pleasures, as from thence

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Sorrow were ever razed and testy wrath

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Could never be her mild companion.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: You gods that made me man, and sway in love,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That have inflamed desire in my breast

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To taste the fruit of yon celestial tree,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Or die in the adventure, be my helps,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: As I am son and servant to your will,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To compass such a boundless happiness!

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Prince Pericles,--

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That would be son to great Antiochus.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Before thee stands this fair Hesperides,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: With golden fruit, but dangerous to be touch'd;

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: For death-like dragons here affright thee hard:

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Her face, like heaven, enticeth thee to view

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Her countless glory, which desert must gain;

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: And which, without desert, because thine eye

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Presumes to reach, all thy whole heap must die.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Yon sometimes famous princes, like thyself,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Drawn by report, adventurous by desire,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Tell thee, with speechless tongues and semblance pale,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: That without covering, save yon field of stars,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Here they stand martyrs, slain in Cupid's wars;

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: And with dead cheeks advise thee to desist

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: For going on death's net, whom none resist.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Antiochus, I thank thee, who hath taught

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My frail mortality to know itself,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And by those fearful objects to prepare

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: This body, like to them, to what I must;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: For death remember'd should be like a mirror,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Who tells us life's but breath, to trust it error.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I'll make my will then, and, as sick men do

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Who know the world, see heaven, but, feeling woe,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Gripe not at earthly joys as erst they did;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: So I bequeath a happy peace to you

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And all good men, as every prince should do;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My riches to the earth from whence they came;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: But my unspotted fire of love to you.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To the Daughter of ANTIOCHUS

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thus ready for the way of life or death,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I wait the sharpest blow, Antiochus.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Scorning advice, read the conclusion then:

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Which read and not expounded, 'tis decreed,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: As these before thee thou thyself shalt bleed.

speaker: Daughter
text_entry: Of all say'd yet, mayst thou prove prosperous!

speaker: Daughter
text_entry: Of all say'd yet, I wish thee happiness!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Like a bold champion, I assume the lists,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Nor ask advice of any other thought

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: But faithfulness and courage.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: He reads the riddle

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I am no viper, yet I feed

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: On mother's flesh which did me breed.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I sought a husband, in which labour

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I found that kindness in a father:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: He's father, son, and husband mild;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I mother, wife, and yet his child.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: How they may be, and yet in two,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: As you will live, resolve it you.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Sharp physic is the last: but, O you powers

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That give heaven countless eyes to view men's acts,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Why cloud they not their sights perpetually,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: If this be true, which makes me pale to read it?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Fair glass of light, I loved you, and could still,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Takes hold of the hand of the Daughter of ANTIOCHUS

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Were not this glorious casket stored with ill:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: But I must tell you, now my thoughts revolt

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: For he's no man on whom perfections wait

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That, knowing sin within, will touch the gate.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: You are a fair viol, and your sense the strings;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Who, finger'd to make man his lawful music,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Would draw heaven down, and all the gods, to hearken:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: But being play'd upon before your time,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Hell only danceth at so harsh a chime.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Good sooth, I care not for you.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Prince Pericles, touch not, upon thy life.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: For that's an article within our law,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: As dangerous as the rest. Your time's expired:

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Either expound now, or receive your sentence.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Great king,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Few love to hear the sins they love to act;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: 'Twould braid yourself too near for me to tell it.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Who has a book of all that monarchs do,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: He's more secure to keep it shut than shown:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: For vice repeated is like the wandering wind.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Blows dust in other's eyes, to spread itself;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And yet the end of all is bought thus dear,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The breath is gone, and the sore eyes see clear:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To stop the air would hurt them. The blind mole casts

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Copp'd hills towards heaven, to tell the earth is throng'd

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: By man's oppression; and the poor worm doth die for't.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Kings are earth's gods; in vice their law's

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: their will;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And if Jove stray, who dares say Jove doth ill?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: It is enough you know; and it is fit,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: What being more known grows worse, to smother it.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: All love the womb that their first being bred,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Then give my tongue like leave to love my head.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: [Aside]  Heaven, that I had thy head! he has found

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: the meaning:

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: But I will gloze with him.--Young prince of Tyre,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Though by the tenor of our strict edict,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Your exposition misinterpreting,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: We might proceed to cancel of your days;

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Yet hope, succeeding from so fair a tree

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: As your fair self, doth tune us otherwise:

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Forty days longer we do respite you;

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: If by which time our secret be undone,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: This mercy shows we'll joy in such a son:

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: And until then your entertain shall be

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: As doth befit our honour and your worth.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Exeunt all but PERICLES

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: How courtesy would seem to cover sin,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: When what is done is like an hypocrite,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The which is good in nothing but in sight!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: If it be true that I interpret false,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Then were it certain you were not so bad

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: As with foul incest to abuse your soul;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Where now you're both a father and a son,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: By your untimely claspings with your child,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Which pleasure fits an husband, not a father;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And she an eater of her mother's flesh,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: By the defiling of her parent's bed;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And both like serpents are, who though they feed

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: On sweetest flowers, yet they poison breed.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Antioch, farewell! for wisdom sees, those men

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Blush not in actions blacker than the night,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Will shun no course to keep them from the light.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: One sin, I know, another doth provoke;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Murder's as near to lust as flame to smoke:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Poison and treason are the hands of sin,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Ay, and the targets, to put off the shame:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Then, lest my lie be cropp'd to keep you clear,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: By flight I'll shun the danger which I fear.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Re-enter ANTIOCHUS

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: He hath found the meaning, for which we mean

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: To have his head.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: He must not live to trumpet forth my infamy,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Nor tell the world Antiochus doth sin

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: In such a loathed manner;

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: And therefore instantly this prince must die:

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: For by his fall my honour must keep high.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Who attends us there?

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Enter THALIARD

speaker: THALIARD
text_entry: Doth your highness call?

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Thaliard,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: You are of our chamber, and our mind partakes

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Her private actions to your secrecy;

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: And for your faithfulness we will advance you.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Thaliard, behold, here's poison, and here's gold;

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: We hate the prince of Tyre, and thou must kill him:

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: It fits thee not to ask the reason why,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Because we bid it. Say, is it done?

speaker: THALIARD
text_entry: My lord,

speaker: THALIARD
text_entry: 'Tis done.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Enough.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Let your breath cool yourself, telling your haste.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: My lord, prince Pericles is fled.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: As thou

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Wilt live, fly after: and like an arrow shot

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: From a well-experienced archer hits the mark

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: His eye doth level at, so thou ne'er return

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Unless thou say 'Prince Pericles is dead.'

speaker: THALIARD
text_entry: My lord,

speaker: THALIARD
text_entry: If I can get him within my pistol's length,

speaker: THALIARD
text_entry: I'll make him sure enough: so, farewell to your highness.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Thaliard, adieu!

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Exit THALIARD

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Till Pericles be dead,

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: My heart can lend no succor to my head.

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
text_entry: Exit
